補.definition: to repair; to patch; to mend; to make up for; to fill (a vacancy); to supplement

補丁.definition: patch (for mending clothes, tires etc); (software) patch

補交.definition: to hand in after the deadline; to pay after the due date

補休.definition: to take deferred time off (to make up for working during the weekend or holidays); compensatory leave

補偏救弊.definition: to remedy defects and correct errors (idiom); to rectify past mistakes

補充.definition: to replenish; to supplement; to complement; additional; supplementary; CL:個|个[ge4]

補刀.definition: (gaming) to finish off a wounded combatant; (fig.) to attack sb who is already under fire; to pile on; (sphragistics) to retouch a seal after taking a first impression

補卡.definition: to replace a lost or damaged SIM card, retaining one's original telephone number; SIM replacement

補回.definition: to make up for; to compensate

補報.definition: to make a report after the event; to make a supplementary report; to repay a kindness

補天浴日.definition: lit. Nüwa mends the Heavens and Xihe bathes the Sun (idiom); fig. (of an achievement, deed, undertaking etc) grand; magnificent; unparalleled

補強.definition: (engineering) to reinforce (a structure); to strengthen; (fig.) to rectify shortcomings

補時.definition: (sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages); (abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time

補法.definition: treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health; reinforcing method (in acupuncture)

補滿.definition: to make up for what is lacking; to fill (a vacancy); to replenish

補牙.definition: to fill a tooth (cavity); to have a tooth filled; a dental filling

補登.definition: record entry (e.g. into a bank passbook)

補發.definition: to supply again (sth lost); to reissue; to pay retroactively

補白.definition: to fill a gap (e.g. a gap in knowledge or blank space in a print layout); to make some additional remarks; filler (in a newspaper or magazine)

補碼.definition: complementary code; binary code with 0 and 1 interchanged

補票.definition: to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc; to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater

補稅.definition: to pay a tax one has evaded; to pay an overdue tax

補種.definition: to reseed; to resow; to replant

補給站.definition: depot; supply station; supply point; staging post

補缺.definition: to fill a vacancy; to make up for a shortage; to supply a deficiency

補缺拾遺.definition: see 拾遺補缺|拾遗补缺[shi2 yi2 bu3 que1]

補習.definition: to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor

補習班.definition: cram class; cram school; evening classes

補考.definition: to sit for a makeup exam; to resit an exam; makeup exam; resit

補覺.definition: to make up for lost sleep

補課.definition: to make up missed lesson; to reschedule a class

補貨.definition: to restock (an item); to replenish inventory

補貼.definition: to subsidize; subsidy; allowance; to supplement (one's salary etc); benefit

補足.definition: to bring up to full strength; to make up a deficiency; to fill (a vacancy, gap etc)

補足音程.definition: complementary interval; addition musical interval adding to an octave

補辦.definition: to do sth after the time it should have been done; to do sth to make up for not having done it before; to reapply for (a lost document, card etc)

補過.definition: to make up for an earlier mistake; to make amends

補釘.definition: variant of 補丁|补丁[bu3 ding5]

補闕.definition: old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]

補靪.definition: variant of 補丁|补丁[bu3 ding5]

補養.definition: to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
